biotools.summary: Software solver that searches for active subnetwork modules that are conserved between two species. It uses a branch-and-cut algorithm that finds provably optimal or near-optimal solutions. Active subnetwork modules are sets of genes, one for each species, which: - induce a connected subnetwork in a species-specific interaction network, - show overall differential behavior, and - contain a large number of orthologous genes.

bioschemas.name: xHeinz
